page.title: 01RANMORE COMMON_BRIEF OUTLINE
page.content: Chalk downlands and heathland rising to 160 ft.above sea level at the highest point in Bagden Wood,and dropping to 85 ft.near Bagden Farm.The area forms two distinct contrasts on chalk soil.The Spains and The Terrace scarp cut into the chalk hillside,and present level downland areas are at present good examples of unmanaged meadow,but if not grazed will become scrubland in approximately twenty years.The Ranmore Common is mainly mixed woodland on clay with flint and dry chalk,facing North.Both areas provide pleasent and varied walks,offering typical examples of plant,insect,animal and bird life. Area a_steep scarp with access from the foot paths running allong the boundary of St.Martins Middle School.
